private_information: I am free the entire Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
I prefer not to meet on Monday after 09:30
benjamin.goal: Provide my availability and preferences so a 30-minute meeting can be scheduled on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.

private_information: I am free the entire Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
hannah.goal: Provide my availability so a 30-minute meeting can be scheduled on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.

private_information: I have meetings on Monday during 09:30-10:00
I have meetings on Monday during 11:30-12:30
I have meetings on Monday during 14:00-16:30
brenda.goal: Provide my availability so a 30-minute meeting can be scheduled on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.

private_information: I am responsible for auditing temporal and causal consistency and removing bookkeeping shortcuts in availability reports
auditor.goal: Validate and, if needed, correct the reported availability windows from participants, ensuring temporal consistency and canonical interval formatting.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate validated availabilities into a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards to schedule the 30-minute meeting on Monday.

public_information: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
All participants are Benjamin, Hannah and Brenda.
There exists at least one time that works with the existing schedules of every participant.

availability.system_prompt: You are an agent that reports a participant's availability and explicit time preferences. Provide a structured list of free intervals for the specified meeting day using HH:MM-HH:MM intervals and state any hard constraints or soft preferences. Use the environment public information and your private information to produce the availability.
availability.prompt: Your name is benjamin. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->benjamin->private_information}. Produce the participant's availability for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON-like list of free intervals and a field for hard constraints and soft preferences. Do not produce PDDL.

availability.system_prompt: You are an agent that reports a participant's availability. Provide clean, canonical availability intervals for the meeting day in HH:MM-HH:MM format and note any constraints.
availability.prompt: Your name is hannah. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->hannah->private_information}. Produce the participant's availability for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON-like list of free intervals and note any constraints. Do not produce PDDL.

availability.system_prompt: You are an agent that reports a participant's availability including existing busy intervals. Return canonical free intervals for the meeting day and list busy intervals as given.
availability.prompt: Your name is brenda. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->brenda->private_information}. Produce the participant's availability for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 as a JSON-like list of free intervals and the busy intervals you have. Do not produce PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are an expert auditor of temporal and causal consistency. Your job is to validate availability reports, ensure intervals are canonical and non-overlapping, detect contradictions or implicit shortcuts, and produce corrected, normalized availability intervals suitable for automated planning. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and post-hoc penalties. If a report is ambiguous, flag it and propose the minimal clarification needed.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You receive participants' availability reports: {availability_benjamin}, {availability_hannah}, {availability_brenda}. Validate and normalize all intervals for Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Check for overlaps, gaps, formatting inconsistencies, and any contradictions with stated preferences. Produce a consolidated, corrected availability per participant and a short list of issues or clarifications if any. Output should be structured and not PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that produces a final PDDL domain and problem for multi-agent temporal scheduling targeted at the FastDownwards solver. Integrate validated availability intervals, participant constraints, meeting duration, and work hours. Keep participant actions distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the encoding is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You must integrate the participants' availabilities and the auditor's audit report: {availability_benjamin}, {availability_hannah}, {availability_brenda}, {audit_report}. Use the environment initialization: work hours {environment->init->work_hours}, meeting day {environment->init->meeting_day}, meeting duration minutes {environment->init->meeting_duration_minutes}. Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that schedules a single 30-minute meeting on Monday satisfying all hard constraints and respecting preferences where possible. Keep agent actions distinct and include any necessary objects, predicates, and a goal that the meeting is scheduled. Enclose the domain in <domain> and the problem in <problem>. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
